perturbation.original_text: 9.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for a period of 1 year after the Effective Date, unless earlier terminated as set forth herein (the "TERM"). This Agreement shall renew for successive 1-year periods, after the initial 1 Year Term, if agreed by both parties in writing within 30 days of license expiration. Either party may terminate the Agreement on 60-days written notice during a renewed term. However, in no event shall termination of this Agreement by MediaNet Group Technologies relieve it of the obligation to remit payment to Reseller for sales or Portals, Hosting Services or other products and services to or through Buyers contracted by Reseller prior to such termination. The obligation to remit payment cease 30 days after termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for a period of 1 year after the Effective Date, unless earlier terminated as set forth herein (the "TERM"). This Agreement shall renew for successive 1-year periods, after the initial 1 Year Term, if agreed by both parties in writing within 30 days of license expiration. Either party may terminate the Agreement on 60-days written notice during a renewed term. Either party may terminate the Agreement on 60-days written notice during a renewed term. However, in no event shall termination of this Agreement by MediaNet Group Technologies relieve it of the obligation to remit payment to Reseller for sales or Portals, Hosting Services or other products and services to or through Buyers contracted by Reseller prior to such termination. The obligation to remit payment cease 180 days after termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that payment obligations cease 30 days after termination, while the modified clause extends this period to 180 days creating contradiction. This inconsistency creates uncertainty about the actual duration of payment obligations following termination, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
Commission

MediaNet Group Technologies tracks the customer sales coming from the reseller and at the end of every calendar month issues a check for 20% commission to the reseller on product sales and 10% the total amount of hosting/maintenance sales made. Commissions are only paid each month if the amount owing exceeds $100 US. MediaNet Group Technologies reserves the right to change the level of commission with out notice. Commission is not paid on MediaNet Group Technologies's free-ware programs. (pricing and products subject to change without notice).
perturbation.changed_text:
Commission

MediaNet Group Technologies tracks the customer sales coming from the reseller and at the end of every calendar month issues a check for 20% commission to the reseller on product sales and 10% the total amount of hosting/maintenance sales made. Commissions are only paid each month if the amount owing exceeds $1000 US. MediaNet Group Technologies reserves the right to change the level of commission with out notice. Commission is not paid on MediaNet Group Technologies's free-ware programs. (pricing and products subject to change without notice).
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states commissions are paid if the amount owing exceeds $100, while the modified clause changes this threshold to $1000. This contradiction creates ambiguity about the minimum commission amount required for payment, leading to potential disputes over unpaid commissions.

perturbation.original_text: 4. The Reseller will then have 5 months to bring the registered prospect to contract. If a contract is not consummated in the allotted time-frame, the prospect shall then revert back to MNG. Reseller may then re-register the prospect subject to the above criteria and/or other criteria in effect at the time.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. The Reseller will then have 2 months to bring the registered prospect to contract. If a contract is not consummated in the allotted time-frame, the prospect shall then revert back to MNG. Reseller may then re-register the prospect subject to the above criteria and/or other criteria in effect at the time.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause gives the Reseller 5 months to bring the registered prospect to contract but after the modification, the time period allowed for that has been reduced to 2 months which creates an in-text contradiction and ultimately confusion in the timeline of prospect registration.
perturbation.location: PROCEDURE FOR REGISTERING PROSPECTIVE          CLIENTS, MEMBER PROVIDERS/ MERCHANTS/MERCHANT MEMBER PROVIDERS
